DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the present proposal was to investigate the predictive properties of markers in exhaled breath to predict an asthma exacerbation. In addition, the reliability of home monitor assessments to measure asthma control will be examined.
DOC.brief_title: Reduction of Asthma Exacerbation Rate in Children by Non-invasive Monitoring of Inflammatory Markers in Exhaled Breath (Condensate): the RASTER Study
DOC.criteria: 1. already known with a diagnosis of asthma during at least 6 months 2. age between 6 and 17 years 3. reversibility to a bronchodilator (increase in FEV1 > 9% of predicted value and/or 4. bronchial hyperresponsiveness to histamine < 8 mg/ml. 1. cardiac abnormalities 2. mental retardation, congenital abnormalities or existence of a syndrome 3. active smoking 4. no technical satisfactory performance of measurements 5. no phone line or internet assess available at home.
